title: Roasted Carrot & Whipped Feta Tart
ingredients: Large bunch of carrots with tops (about 800g)
40g grated parmesan or vegetarian hard cheese
25g parsley, roughly chopped, plus whole leaves to serve
200g feta, drained and crumbled (vegetarian, if needed)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Trim carrot tops, halve carrots lengthways, toss with olive oil and seasoning, and roast for 25–30 mins. Stir in za’atar and honey, then set aside.
Blitz carrot tops with extra virgin olive oil in a food processor. Add garlic, walnuts, parmesan, and parsley. Pulse to combine. Add more oil if needed. Season to taste.
Clean processor, then blend feta, yogurt, most of the lemon zest, and seasoning until smooth.

Heat a baking tray in the oven. Roll pastry into a 40x30cm rectangle on parchment. Score a 2cm border, brush with egg, sprinkle salt, and bake for 15–20 mins until golden. Press down the center gently.
Cool for 5–10 mins. Spread whipped feta over the center, top with roasted carrots, drizzle pesto, scatter parsley and remaining lemon zest. Slice and serve.
notes: If you don’t have walnuts, substitute with any nuts you have.
Leftover pesto can be frozen in ice cube trays for up to 3 months.
If your carrots don’t have tops, use parsley or leftover pesto instead.
